intro: Dysosma lichuanensis, commonly known as the Lichuan dysosma, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
